content.question: The work on the left is a rare icon that survived iconoclasm, which was

choices.label: the banning or destruction of religious figurative images
a guild regulation about artists' qualifications
a law restricting and confiscating luxury materials
an edict prohibiting the observance of religious ritual

content.answer: the banning or destruction of religious figurative images

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.4: Purpose and Audience in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe contextual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. function.  b. context.  c. siting or physical context.  d. subject matter.  e. reception.
